org.droitateddb

Class EntityService<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.droitateddb.EntityService<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - Entity, for which this service will be used
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConnectedEntityService

    public class EntityService<E>
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides support for executing CRUD operations on Entity classes, such getting them from the database or saving them to the database.

    Each operation opens a connection to the SQLiteDatabase. If you want only one db connection use ConnectedEntityService
    Author:
    Falk Appel, Alexander Frank

      • dbCreator

        protected DbCreator dbCreator

    • Constructor Detail

      • EntityService

        public EntityService(android.content.Context context,
                     java.lang.Class<E> entityClass)
        Creates a EntityService for the given Entity.
        The validation when saving Entitys is turned on.
        Parameters:
        context - Android context
        entityClass - Class of the Entity, the service should be used for
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When the given entityClass is no Entity

      • EntityService

        public EntityService(android.content.Context context,
                     java.lang.Class<E> entityClass,
                     ValidationToggle toggle)
        Creates a EntityService for the given Entity
        Parameters:
        context - Android context
        entityClass - Class of the Entity, the service should be used for
        toggle - Controls the use of validation on saving Entitys
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When the given entityClass is no Entity

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public java.util.List<E> get()
        Reads all Entitys of the service specific type from the database
        Returns:
        All Entitys stored in the database, if non are found a empty list is returned

      • get

        public E get(int id)
        Gets a specific Entity according to the given id
        Parameters:
        id - primary key of the Entity
        Returns:
        The Entity to the given id, or null if non was found

      • closeDB

        protected void closeDB(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase database)

      • openDB

        protected android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase openDB()

      • find

        public java.util.List<E> find(java.lang.String selection,
                              java.lang.String[] selectionArgs,
                              java.lang.String order)
        Search for Entitys in the database with basic SQL WHERE statements.
        Parameters:
        selection - SQL WHERE statement
        selectionArgs - Arguments for the WHERE statement
        order - Sort order of the result
        Returns:
        All found Entitys or an empty list of non are found

      • resolveAssociations

        public void resolveAssociations(E data)
        Resolves the associations to a given Entity object and all underlying associations within the object graph.
        Parameters:
        data - Entity on which the associations should be resolved

      • resolveAssociations

        public void resolveAssociations(E data,
                                int maxDepth)
        Resolves the associations to a given Entity object. The associations will only be resolved to the given depth within the object graph.
        Parameters:
        data - Entity on which the associations should be resolved
        maxDepth - The maximum depth to which the associations should be resolved

      • save

        public int save(E data)
        Stores the given Entity to the database. All attached associations will be stored as well.
        Parameters:
        data - Entity which should be stored
        Returns:
        The primary key of the given data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - When the PrimaryKey field and its value of the Entity could not be determined
        InvalidEntityException - when the given entity is invalid.

      • save

        public int save(E data,
                int maxDepth)
        Stores the given Entity to the database. Associated objects will be saved to the given maxDepth.
        maxDepth of 0 means that only the given Entity itself will be saved without associations.
        Parameters:
        data - Entity which should be stored
        maxDepth - The maximum depth of the associated objects which should also be saved.
        Returns:
        The primary key of the given data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - When the PrimaryKey field and its value of the Entity could not be determined
        InvalidEntityException - when the given entity is invalid.

      • save

        public void save(java.util.Collection<E> data)
        Stores all given Entitys in the Collection to the database. All attached associations will be stored as well.
        Parameters:
        data - Entitys which should be stored
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - When the PrimaryKey field and its value of the Entity could not be determined
        InvalidEntityException - when at least one of the given entities is invalid.

      • save

        public void save(java.util.Collection<E> data,
                 int maxDepth)
        Stores all given Entitys in the Collection to the database. Associated objects will be saved to the given maxDepth.
        maxDepth of 0 means that only the given Entity itself will be saved without associations.
        Parameters:
        data - Entity which should be stored
        maxDepth - The maximum depth of the associated objects which should also be saved.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - When the PrimaryKey field and its value of the Entity could not be determined
        InvalidEntityException - when at least one of the given entities is invalid.

      • delete

        public boolean delete(E data)
        Deletes the given Entity from the database
        Parameters:
        data - Entity that should be deleted
        Returns:
        true if the Entity could be deleted, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - When the PrimaryKey field and its value of the Entity could not be determined
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When the value of the PrimaryKey field is null

      • delete

        public boolean delete(int id)
        Deletes the data of the Entity for the given id
        Parameters:
        id - primary key of the Entity to be deleted
        Returns:
        true if the Entity could be deleted, false otherwise

      • close

        @Deprecated
public void close()
        Deprecated. 
        Will be removed with Version 0.2.0
        Use ConnectedEntityService if you need only one db connection.
